sen.j: 北埔事件（ほくふじけん）は、日本統治時代 (台湾)の台湾で発生した客家人の蔡清琳による抗日事件。
sen.e: The Hokufu Jiken was an anti-Japanese incident caused by Kai Shin Lin, one of the Hakka people who originated in Taiwan during the period of Japanese rule (in Taiwan).
sen.cmt: インターネットによる発音は→蔡清琳 [cai cinˊ limˇ]です。
sen.e: The Beipu Incident was an anti-Japanese incident in Taiwan that occurred during the period of Japanese rule (in Taiwan) and that was instigated by Tsai Ching-Lin, one of the Hakka people.
sen.cmt: 翻訳された文章の内容が原文と一致してません。蔡清琳→Tsai Ching-Lin [http://www.taipeitimes.com/News/editorials/archives/2007/11/28/2003390242]
sen.e: The Beipu Incident was an anti-Japanese incident in Taiwan that occurred during the period of Japanese rule (in Taiwan) and that was instigated by Tsai Ching-Lin, one of the Hakka people.

sen.j: 事件のリーダーである蔡清琳は、元々警官であったが理念の違いから辞めてしまっていた。
sen.e: Kai Shin Lin, who was the leader of the incident, resigned from the police because of the difference of ideal though he was originally a policeman.
Tsai Ching-Lin, who was the leader of the incident was originally a police officer but resigned due to a conflict with his ideology.
sen.cmt: 繰り返して書いてあるので編集しました。
sen.e: Tsai Ching-Lin, who was the leader of the incident was originally a police officer but resigned due to a conflict with his ideology.

sen.j: 1907年11月、蔡清琳は新竹県北埔郷の山岳部にいる漢人と台湾原住民であるサイシャット族の者たちに対して、「聯合復中興の総裁」と自称し、「清の大軍がまもなく新竹に上陸する」と騙した。
sen.e: In November, 1907, Kai Shin Lin told a lie, that the great army of Qing was soon landing on Xinzhu, calling himself 'the president of the restoration of Yonhap' against the Han race living in the mountain in Hokufu Village, Shinchiku Prefecture and the Sai si yat who were the indigenous people of Taiwan.
sen.cmt: 聯合復中興の総裁、サイシャット族→定訳不明です。
sen.e: Tsai Ching-Lin lied to the Han living in the mountains of Beipu, Hsinchu County and the Saisiyat of the indigenous people of Taiwan in November 1907, that the 'great army of Qing will soon land in Hsinchu', while himself 'the president of the restoration of Yonhap.'
sen.cmt: Run-on sentenceで北埔郷＝Beipu、新竹県＝Hsinchu Countyでした。
sen.e: Tsai Ching-Lin lied to the Han living in the mountains of Beipu, Hsinchu County and the Saisiyat of the indigenous people of Taiwan in November 1907, that the 'great army of Qing will soon land in Hsinchu', while himself 'the president of the restoration of Yonhap.'

sen.j: また、サイシャット族大隘社の頭目であった大打祿（漢名は趙明政）を誘い、高額な殺害報酬（例として「日本人巡査の剣を奪えば賞金20元」など）を示して巧みに人を集めた。
sen.e: He also cleverly gathered people by showing the big paycheck for killing (for example, twenty yuans in cash would be paid if Japanese patrol officer's sword was taken from), inducing 大打祿 (his Chinese name was Cho Mei Sei), who was the chief of 大隘社 of the Sai si yat to work together.
sen.cmt: 大打祿、大隘社→読み方不明です。
sen.e: He also induced 大打祿 (his Chinese name was 趙明政), who was the chief of 大隘社 of the Saisiyat, and cleverly gathered people by showing the big reward for assassination (for example, 'twenty yuans in compensation for stealing Japanese patrol officer's sword').
sen.cmt: 大打祿、大隘社、趙明政[定訳不明]
sen.e: He also induced 大打祿 (his Chinese name was 趙明政), who was the chief of 大隘社 of the Saisiyat, and cleverly gathered people by showing the big reward for assassination (for example, 'twenty yuans in compensation for stealing Japanese patrol officer's sword').

sen.j: 11月14日、蔡清琳は群集を煽動して暴動を起こし、北埔地区を襲撃して日本人警察官や市民など57人を殺害した。
sen.e: On November 14, Kai Shin Lin raised a riot by instigating the assembled crowd and killed the fifty-seven people such as Japanese citizenries and police officers, attacking the Hokufu District.
On November 14, Tsai Ching-Lin raised a riot by instigating the assembled crowd and attacked the Beipu district to kill 57 people such as Japanese police officers and citizens.
On November 14, Tsai Ching-Lin raised a riot by instigating the assembled crowd and attacked the Beipu district to kill 57 people such as Japanese police officers and citizens.

sen.j: しかし、蔡清琳にはこれに対して何の動きも無かった。
sen.e: However, Kai Shin Lin did nothing in response.
However, Tsai Ching-Lin did nothing in response.
However, Tsai Ching-Lin did nothing in response.

sen.j: その後、蔡清琳に同調していたサイシャット族の者たちは騙されていたことを知り、蔡清琳は殺害されてしまう。
sen.e: He was later killed by people of the Sai si yat supporting him when they knew that they were deceived.
He was later killed by people of the Sai si yat supporting him when they knew that they were deceived.
He was later killed by people of the Sai si yat supporting him when they knew that they were deceived.

sen.j: 事件後、台湾総督府の警察は北埔の支援に向かい、100人あまりを逮捕した。
sen.e: The police of Taiwan Sotoku-fu (Taiwan Government-General) headed to Hokufu to help there and arrested about one hundred people after the incident.
The police officers of the Governor General of Taiwan headed to assist Beipu after the incident and arrested about 100 people.
The police officers of the Governor General of Taiwan headed to assist Beipu after the incident and arrested about 100 people.

sen.j: 裁判の結果、事件の首謀者9人が台湾総督府によって死刑に処され、有期刑や行政処分にあった者も97人を数えた。
sen.e: The outcome of the trial resulted in the execution of capital punishment on the nine ringleaders of the affair by Taiwan Sotoku-fu, and the convicts sentenced to imprisonment for a definite term or imposed an administrative punishment were more than ninety-seven.

The outcome of the trial resulted in the execution of nine ringleaders of the affair by the Governor General of Taiwan, and more than 97 people were sentenced to imprisonment for a definite term or an administrative punishment.

The outcome of the trial resulted in the execution of nine ringleaders of the affair by the Governor General of Taiwan, and more than 97 people were sentenced to imprisonment for a definite term or an administrative punishment.

sen.j: さらに、秘密裡に死刑にされた多くの客家人がいる。
sen.e: Furthermore, there were a lot of Hakka people who were sentenced to death in secret.

sen.j: しかし、当時の原住民族に対する懐柔政策により、サイシャット族はわずかに銃などを没収されるだけにとどまった。
sen.e: However, the Sai si yat was only seized their belongings including the guns in accordance with the appeasement policy on the indigenous people.
However, only guns were seized from the Saisiyat in accordance with the conciliatory policy on the indigenous people at that time.
sen.cmt: 文章を省略しました。「当時の」の翻訳が抜けていましたので編集しました。
sen.e: However, only guns were seized from the Saisiyat in accordance with the conciliatory policy on the indigenous people at that time.

sen.j: 趙明政は、死んだこととして隠居し、災禍を避けた。
sen.e: 趙明政 was able to retire by making others believe that he had died, thus avoiding this punishment.
sen.cmt: 訳抜けを訳出「趙明政」読み不明

sen.j: この抗日事件で蜂起した者の多くは、隘勇線の漢人兵か隘勇線外に住む原住民であった。
sen.e: Many of the people who uprose in this anti-Japanese incident were the Chinese soldiers staying around the Aiyu line (a guard line established by the government against the unsubjugated aborigines) or the native tribes residing outside the line.
Many of the people who uprose in this anti-Japanese incident were the Han soldiers stationed at Ai-Yun Line (Guardsmen Line) or the indigenous people residing outside the line.
Many of the people who uprose in this anti-Japanese incident were the Han soldiers stationed at Ai-Yun Line (Guardsmen Line) or the indigenous people residing outside the line.

sen.j: 台湾総督府はこの事件を踏まえてこれらの組織の整理を行った。
sen.e: The staff shake-ups were taken place by Taiwan Sotoku-fu based on the lessons and reflections from this incident.
Governor General of Taiwan reorganized these organizations due to this incident.
sen.cmt: シンプルに変更しました。
sen.e: Governor General of Taiwan reorganized these organizations due to this incident.

sen.j: また、理蕃政策を再調整するとともに強化を行った。
sen.e: They also enforced and realigned the Riban policy (the policy of subjugating and forcibly assimilating the aborigines).
They also enforced and realigned the Riban policy (the policy of subjugating and forcibly assimilating the aborigines).
They also enforced and realigned the Riban policy (the policy of subjugating and forcibly assimilating the aborigines).

sen.j: その結果、漢人の手を借りずに直接原住民を管理する政策に改められた。
sen.e: As a result, it was revised to a policy of managing the indigenous people directly without the Han.
As a result, it was revised to a policy of managing the indigenous people directly without the Han.
As a result, it was revised to a policy of managing the indigenous people directly without the Han.

sen.j: しかしながら、その後も台湾原住民による抗日事件として、さらに大きな霧社事件が起きることとなる。
sen.e: In this regard, however, the bigger Musha Incident was caused by the aborigines as the later rebellion against Japanese colonial forces in Taiwan.
However, the bigger Wushe Incident later occurred as the anti-Japanese movement by the Taiwanese indigenous people.
